org.firmata4j.firmata

Class FirmataMessageFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.firmata4j.firmata.FirmataMessageFactory

  • public class FirmataMessageFactory
extends Object
    This class contains methods that help to build command messages for Firmata device.
    Author:
    Oleg Kurbatov <o.v.kurbatov@gmail.com>

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static byte[] ANALOG_MAPPING_REQUEST
      The analog mapping query provides the information about which pins (as used with Firmata's pin mode message) correspond to the analog channels.
      static byte[] REQUEST_CAPABILITY
      This message requests capability repot of a Firmata device.
      static byte[] REQUEST_FIRMWARE
      This message requests firmware version of a Firmata device.

    • Method Detail

      • i2cConfigRequest

        public static byte[] i2cConfigRequest(int delayInMicroseconds)
        Creates SysEx message that configures I2C setup.
        Parameters:
        delayInMicroseconds - delay between the moment a register is written to and the moment when the data can be read from that register (optional, when I2C device requires a delay)
        Returns:
        message that configures I2C

      • i2cWriteRequest

        public static byte[] i2cWriteRequest(byte slaveAddress,
                                     byte... bytesToWrite)
        Builds a message that asks a Firmata device to send specified data to specified I2C device. Does not support 10-bit mode.
        Parameters:
        slaveAddress - address of the I2C device you want to talk to
        bytesToWrite - data to send to the slaveAdderss
        Returns:
        the message

      • i2cReadRequest

        public static byte[] i2cReadRequest(byte slaveAddress,
                                    int register,
                                    int bytesToRead,
                                    boolean continuous)
        Builds a message that asks a Firmata device to read data from an I2C device. Does not support 10-bit mode.
        Parameters:
        slaveAddress - address of the I2C device you want to talk to
        register - The device register to read from.
        bytesToRead - the number of bytes that the device will return
        continuous - repeatedly send updates until asked to stop
        Returns:
        the message

      • i2cStopContinuousRequest

        public static byte[] i2cStopContinuousRequest(byte slaveAddress)
        Builds a message that terminates receiving continuous updates from specified I2C device.
        Parameters:
        slaveAddress - address of the I2C device you want to shut up
        Returns:
        the message

      • pinStateRequest

        public static byte[] pinStateRequest(byte pinId)
        Builds a message that requests a state of specified pin.
        Parameters:
        pinId - index of the pin
        Returns:
        message that requests a state of the pin

      • analogReport

        public static byte[] analogReport(boolean enable)
        Builds message to enable or disable reporting from Firmata device on change of analog input.
        Parameters:
        enable - message enables analog reporting if true and disable if false
        Returns:
        message that enables or disables analog reporting

      • digitalReport

        public static byte[] digitalReport(boolean enable)
        Builds message to enable or disable reporting from Firmata device on change of digital input.
        Parameters:
        enable - message enables digital reporting if true and disable if false
        Returns:
        message that enables or disables digital reporting

      • setMode

        public static byte[] setMode(byte pinId,
                             Pin.Mode mode)
        Creates the message that assigns particular mode to specified pin.
        Parameters:
        pinId - index of the pin
        mode - mode
        Returns:
        message that assigns particular mode to specified pin

      • setDigitalPinValue

        public static byte[] setDigitalPinValue(byte portId,
                                        byte value)
        Creates Firmata message to set digital values of port's pins.
        Digital value should be assigned to a set of pins at once. A set of pins is called port.
        A port contains 8 pins. Digital value of every pin in a set transfers in one byte. Every bit in the byte represents state of pin's output.
        Parameters:
        portId - index of a port
        value - values of port's pins
        Returns:
        Firmata message to set digital output

      • setAnalogPinValue

        public static byte[] setAnalogPinValue(byte pinId,
                                       long value)
        Creates Firmata message to set value of an output pin in PWM mode.
        If pin id is beyond 15th or value is greater than we can put into standard analog message, extended analog message is built.
        Parameters:
        pinId - index of the pin
        value - value to be set
        Returns:
        Firmata message to set PWM output

      • setSamplingInterval

        public static byte[] setSamplingInterval(int value)
        Creates a message to set sampling interval.
        The sampling interval sets how often analog data and i2c data is reported to the client. The default value is 19 milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        value - sampling interval in milliseconds
        Returns:
        Firmata message to set sampling interval

      • servoConfig

        public static byte[] servoConfig(byte pinId,
                                 int minPulse,
                                 int maxPulse)
        Builds servo configuration message.
        The core idea is to just add a "config" message, then use setMode(byte, org.firmata4j.Pin.Mode) to attach/detach Servo support to a pin. Then the normal setAnalogPinValue(byte, long) is used to send data.
        Parameters:
        pinId -
        minPulse -
        maxPulse -
        Returns:

      • stringMessage

        public static byte[] stringMessage(String message)
        Encodes the string as a SysEx message.
        Parameters:
        message - string message
        Returns:
        SysEx message
